timeline.bodyText: I think just Regulates whether fire should spread in a world. would be better. The field's type already tells us it's a GameRule, the comment should just describe what we can't see from its type or name.
timeline.author: Runemoro
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,53 @@
 CLASS net/minecraft/class_1928 net/minecraft/world/GameRules
+	FIELD field_19387 Lnet/minecraft/class_1928$class_4313;
+		COMMENT A GameRule which regulates whether fire should spread in a world.

timeline.bodyText: I'd either have these say {@link GameRule} or game rule
timeline.author: 2xsaiko
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,53 @@
 CLASS net/minecraft/class_1928 net/minecraft/world/GameRules
+	FIELD field_19387 Lnet/minecraft/class_1928$class_4313;
+		COMMENT A GameRule which regulates whether fire should spread in a world.

timeline.bodyText: occurring
timeline.author: 2xsaiko

timeline.bodyText: You should use {@link} here instead of {@linkplain} as they are code names, not plain text. You don't call them "GameRules" but "game rules" when you're not talking about the class.
timeline.author: Juuxel

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            		COMMENT <li>Whether explosions from a Creeper destory blocks
          
          
            
            		COMMENT <li>Whether explosions from a Creeper destroy blocks

    + COMMENT
  • Whether creeper explosions destroy blocks + COMMENT
  • Whether a zombie can break down a door + COMMENT

timeline.message: Github is not good at conflicts with suggestions.
